de.gidoo.owl
Class AlphabetOrder

java.lang.Object
  de.gidoo.owl.AlphabetOrder
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Comparator<Entry>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlphabetOrderLight
public class AlphabetOrder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<Entry>

Describes the order of characters of a natural language.

It uses a XML-file which contains information about which characters (small and capital are handled equal) comes first in the order. Additionally it says which string should be replaced by other strings before compararion. E.g. the German umlaut "ü" is treated as "u".

Author:
Thomas Krause

doc

private org.jdom.Document doc
The xml-document with the information about the order. It's elements are accessable whenever needed.

charOrder

private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> charOrder
Holds the index in the order for every character. The value of the character is used as key of the hash-map
